intro: Cuphea spermacoce var. angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while the stems are erect and branched. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
